title: Marshmallow Buttercream Frosting Recipe
description: Combining softened butter with confectioners' sugar and marshmallow creme makes a cake frosting that's light, sweet, and easy to work with. A hint of almond extract adds flavor.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Frostings and Icings White Marshmallow Buttercream Frosting 4.4 (145) 130 Reviews 32 Photos Perfect for any cake! Submitted by Staci Lambert Updated on June 9, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 5 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 cups butter, softened 2 ½ cups confectioners' sugar 1 teaspoon almond extract 1 (13 ounce) jar marshmallow creme Directions Cream butter in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium until butter is soft and fluffy. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar, about 1/2 cup at a time; beat in almond extract. Gently fold the marshmallow creme into the frosting until thoroughly incorporated. I Made It Print 295 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Marshmallow Buttercream Frosting 01 of 32 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 32 Photo by  Len Wentworth 08/28/2022 Very easy to whip up. I, too, thought it was a little too sweet. I added a half cup of cocoa powder. I like it very much; thanks to all for the tips.Changes I made - I used vanilla extract, didn't have any almond. (Next time :-)) Think I let the butter melt too much. Had to wait awhile for it to set up. Added sprinkles - the grandkids like color. 03 of 32 Photo by  Becca Owens 04/28/2021 Dee. Lish. Usss. This was sooo good. It's buttery, but will still pipe nicely and doesn't fall flat. I added a couple of pinches of salt because I like salty sweet. Will definitely make this again. 04 of 32 Photo by  Chancy W 08/09/2020 This recipe makes a really large serving. I cut the recipe in half and still had a lot leftover. I used this frosting to fill my pumpkin cookie whoopie pies and it was perfect. Excellent flavor and texture. I used vanilla extract but will probably experiment with different ones in the future. This is my new go-to frosting recipe. Thank you 05 of 32 Photo by  Patricia 05/31/2020 The icing was easy to use and my cake looks beautiful. Everyone liked it too! 06 of 32 Photo by  Ann-Lynn Nelson 07/04/2019 07 of 32 Photo by  Stephanie Maloney 04/06/2019 I love this recipe. I use it the most frequently for cupcakes and cakes I make. For my birthday cake this last year, I made a chocolate dream cake and even added some vanilla instead of almond extract and I added cocoa powder and some heavy cream to make chocolate marshmallow buttercream! It was delicious!! 08 of 32 Photo by  Stephanie Maloney 04/06/2019 I love this recipe. I use it the most frequently for cupcakes and cakes I make. For my birthday cake this last year, I made a chocolate dream cake and even added some vanilla instead of almond extract and I added cocoa powder and some heavy cream to make chocolate marshmallow buttercream! It was delicious!! 09 of 32 Photo by  Danielle Torre Baci 10/02/2018 10 of 32 Photo by  Kim Carnahan 08/06/2018 I admit that I was skeptical about a buttercream that uses SO MUCH butter and SO LITTLE powdered sugar! However, the marshmallow creme stirs in like a dream and adds a fluffiness that I've never see in a buttercream! This frosting melts in your mouth and the almond flavor is delectable. I was looking for a delicious, light textured frosting for delicate, tiny sandwich cookies I'm making for a wedding. This is marvelous, and I will use it again and again! SIX YEARS LATER: I’ve used this incredible buttercream recipe for every single cake I’ve made, from my signature carrot cake to my grandchildren’s birthday cakes, and it ALWAYS turns out perfect, makes a huge quantity, tastes delicious, decorates beautifully! I just made it again today for my carrot cake! A lifetime recipe, in my opinion! (At times I use 1/2 almond extract and 1/2 vanilla extract, just as my mood dictates.) 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Easiest, Most Delicious Meringue Buttercream 134 Ratings Fluffy Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 5 Ratings Homemade Chocolate Frosting 101 Ratings Mascarpone Buttercream Frosting 5 Ratings Vanilla - Chocolate Powdered Sugar Frosting 588 Ratings Simple and Delicious Buttercream Frosting 233 Ratings Cherry Buttercream Frosting 4 Ratings Lisa's Banana Butter Frosting 27 Ratings Strawberries and Cream Buttercream 2 Ratings Sarah's Italian Meringue Buttercream 1 Rating Italian Meringue Buttercream 6 Ratings Perfect Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 7 Ratings Ermine Frosting 4 Ratings French Chocolate Buttercream 1 Rating Buttermilk-Chocolate Buttercream Frosting 5 Ratings Basic Chocolate Buttercream Icing 55 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Staci Lambert
instructions: Cream butter in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium until butter is soft and fluffy. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar, about 1/2 cup at a time; beat in almond extract. Gently fold the marshmallow creme into the frosting until thoroughly incorporated.
